pli-tv-bu-vb-sk22:2.1: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk22:5.1: 22. The second training rule on arms akimbo
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk22:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk22:6.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were sitting in inhabited areas with arms akimbo. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk22:7.2: “‘I will not sit in inhabited areas with arms akimbo,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk22:8.1: Sitting in an inhabited area, one should not have one’s arms akimbo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk22:8.2: If a monk, out of disrespect, has one or both arms akimbo while sitting in an inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk22:9.9: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk22:10.1: The second training rule is finished.
